Tools

This is the tools page where you can find the software I use for my reverse engineering.

Negentropy

Negentropy is a disassembler for the C64 that Iâ€™m working on written in Python. Itâ€™s the tool used to generate the disassemblies on this site, all of which are unedited output, images and all. Itâ€™s my first real Python program and is still a work in progress, but nevertheless itâ€™s quite useful. The repo can be found here. Hereâ€™s a list of some of the features currently implemented:

  • Generate HTML pages, complete with images and links.
  • Disassemble 6502 machine code.
  • List BASIC programs.
  • Annotate the generated output with labels and comments provided in configuration files.
  • Generate images for character sets.
  • Links, including in BASIC programs, machine code programs and even from SYS commands in BASIC to the target code.

In addition to Pythonâ€™s standard library the following packages are used:

  • Jinja2 - used for templates. Currently only HTML is supported (there are other incomplete templates). Checkout its website here
  • Pillow - for image generation. Itâ€™s website
  • Lark - for parsing. Itâ€™s LALR parser is bloody fast (and its author tolerant of stupid questionsðŸ˜Š). Itâ€™s website
